nodes.bodyText:
For consistency with https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/resource_names and with our workspaces paths, it would be ideal for this path to use plural on the resource type, e.g. 'users/:userId' and for the path above to be 'users'. (It would be nice to maintain backwards-compatibility on the 'user' path, and/or create a redirect route, in case someone has the user admin table page bookmarked there.)
It hasn't been codified yet, but we're increasingly moving towards using https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/ as a base "style guide" for API design where possible, and only veering from that when necessary.
Can do.

I think the name change to initialValue isn't accurate – as best I can tell, react-switch is a controlled component in React terminology, e.g. it will always render the checked prop value (code ref).
I'd propose renaming this prop to checked for clarify & consistency with the react-switch prop name.
checked is shadowed by Switch, which is a prime-react component, and Javascript is too block-scoped to handle three checkeds, so I have to call it anything other than checked...
I can call it value though.
Oh or isChecked...
I like value, just be sure to type-annotate it as a boolean for clarity.
I'll have to turn it into a proper component for that, but it's probably complicated enough anyways

It's mildly annoying that these hard-coded values are repeated a handful of times... but I won't press too hard on fixing this since (I think?) it's likely that this component will go away sometime in the near future anyway.
I tried defaulting them in the Toggle const and for whatever reason it didn't work.

Are we 100% clear on what "Registration date" is meant to represent? I'm a little surprised that we don't have a field here for "user creation date" — unless Lou and Karthik are expecting that's what will show up in this input box?

I talked with Karthik and Joel about this and this is the field that I should be using; it's meant to differentiate between 'never registered' and 'disabled and therefore deregistered'. I don't think we actually capture 'user creation date'. There's a 'first time logged in' date but I'm not sure offhand whether that is the same as 'finished creating my user'.
OK – makes sense. (For posterity / reference, I do think we track user creation time here.)
Thanks for the find.
Do we want to keep beta access request time, even though beta access module isn't expected to be enabled in prod in the long term?
It's enabled in prod for the moment, so admins need to be able to bypass it.
I don't think it is enabled (code ref)
Ooh, I'll ask Karthik then

This is a convenient / simple trick, but it wont' be correct if the user makes a change to an input and then changes it back to the original value. It's a bit more work, but technically cleaner, to do an actual client-side comparison of the form's "draft" object against the latest version of the object from the server. That way you'll only show the "save" button enabled when there are actual pending changes to be saved.
I was hoping to avoid implementing any details of the follow on tickets in this ticket.
sgtm

Separate comment on this line: I think the URL path param should be username, not user ID. I'd advocated for this in the original design doc – it's important because we may want external systems to be able to create inbound links to our admin pages, so we should use externally-meaningful URL paths wherever possible.
The username is a research-aou.org email address. What about everything in front of the @?
Nice – it's helpful even just to have the props split out and typed like that.
nit: add some sort of user-visible error handling here, e.g. what happens if the server returns a 404?
Same nitpick here: it would be nice to have some sort of error message if the institutions API call fails for some reason.
